intro: Viguiera schultzii, commonly known as the Schultze's blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces showy blue to purple flower clusters that bloom in late spring to early summer. Viguiera schultzii is typically found in rocky soils and arid environments, making it well adapted to drought conditions. It serves as a valuable nectar source for pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
